basics.name: Branyes Nuñez Abad
basics.label: Full Stack Developer with over 4 years of experience.
basics.summary: I am a highly skilled Full Stack Developer with over 4 years of experience in the technology sector, spanning industries such as Finance, Telecommunications, ERP, and Insurance. My expertise includes Quality Assurance (QA), both manual and automated, using tools like Selenium, Katalon Studio, Rational Functional Testing, Appium, and PyAutoGUI. As a Web Developer and Agile Team Lead, I specialize in delivering robust and scalable solutions using technologies such as Java Spring Boot, ASP.NET, React.js, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Python, and Azure Face Recognition. Additionally, I have extensive experience in technical support and computer repair, including diagnosing and resolving hardware and software issues, ensuring optimal system performance, and maintaining high customer satisfaction. My diverse skill set and dedication to excellence make me a valuable asset to any team.

work.name: Disoft
work.summary: I was responsible for database maintenance, creating backups, generating reports with Crystal Reports and Firebird, and managing all database-related tasks.

work.name: BHD Bank
work.summary: I was responsible for mobile application automation using tools like Appium with Katalon Studio, Java, and Android Studio. Additionally, I automated a desktop application with Rational Functional Testing using Java and led the mobile automation team.

work.name: Claro Dominicana
work.summary: I was responsible for automating the company’s most critical desktop applications and also served as the supervisor for the API and microservices automation team. I contributed significantly by introducing automation practices to the company, which previously had none. I established automation standards, developed guidelines, and created a framework using Java and Selenium to maintain these standards, as well as a reporting system to visualize automation results.

work.name: Humano Seguros
work.summary: I was responsible for automating one of the company’s most important and innovative products: a self-service kiosk device equipped with AI for document and facial recognition, designed to assist elderly users with process completion through artificial intelligence. As the automation lead for this project, I added significant value to QA by implementing automation standards, building an automation framework, and creating a reporting system to track automation results. When I took over, the company had no automation standards, and today, thanks to my contributions, the application is in one of its best QA states. Tools used included Java, Selenium, TestNG Reporter Log, and Extent Reports, among others.

work.name: Humano Seguros
work.summary: Thanks to my contributions to the Kiosk Automation project, I advanced to Senior Developer and took on leadership for the development team. I drove quality improvements and feature development for the application, including one of the most in-demand features in the market—a service for purchasing car and travel insurance directly through the app. This feature, previously only available on mobile apps, was considered challenging to implement in the kiosk environment. However, through significant efforts, the application now successfully offers these options, making it highly competitive and driving strong revenue in the commercial market. It is now ranked as the company's second-highest revenue-generating application, behind only the mobile apps, after initially being ranked sixth. Tools used include React.js, TypeScript, Java Spring Boot, ASP.NET, PostgreSQL, Python, Azure Face Recognition, among others that keep the application interactive and cutting-edge.

work.name: Dacodes
work.summary: I worked here after finishing my studies at Academlo, putting into practice the knowledge I gained in JavaScript and Python with Django. Here, we developed an application for a school.

work.name: Banco Santa Cruz
work.summary: Served on the collections and customer service team, contacting clients about upcoming loan and credit card payments to ensure timely payments and help avoid late fees. Effectively reduced delinquency rates through proactive outreach while maintaining high customer satisfaction scores.

work.name: Punto Mac
work.summary: Initially served as a Customer Service Representative before promotion to Mac Technician. Responsible for diagnosing and repairing hardware and software issues in MacBook, iMac, and other Apple products. Maintained clear customer communication throughout the repair process.
